explosives.rationale: There are no chemical groups associated with explosive properties present in the molecules.

self_reactive_substances.rationale: There are no chemical groups present in the molecule associated with explosive or self-reactive properties.

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures which, in contact with water, emit flammable gases
substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.rationale: The chemical structure of the substance does not contain metals or metalloids (B, Si, P, Ge, As, Se, Sn, Sb, Te, Bi, Po, At).

oxidizing_liquids.rationale: The substance contains chlorine (but not fluorine or oxygen), which is chemically bonded only to carbon or hydrogen.

organic_peroxides.rationale: Organic compounds containing no bivalent -O-O- structure

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale: Its rat LD50 values obtained through oral administration are reported to be 652, 581, 685, and 1350 mg/kg (DFGOT vol. 10 (1998)). These values were statistically processed to obtain the representative LD50 of 581 mg/kg. Based on this value, the substance was classified into Category 4.

acute_toxicity_dermal.rationale: Since its rabbit LD50 = 1900 mg/kg (DFGOT vol. 10, 1998), the substance was classified into Category 4.

acute_toxicity_inhalation_gas.rationale: Since the substance is a liquid (GHS definition), it was classified into the "Not applicable" category.

acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.rationale: Its rat LD50 is reported to be 0.125 mg/L (DFGOT vol. 10, 1998). However, since exposure time is not provided, classification is not possible.

skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale: In rabbits that were treated dermally with the substance for 24 hours, whitening of the skin and moderate to severe edema were observed. During the following 8 days the skin dried out and discoloration developed (DFGOT vol. 10 (1998)). Thus, the substance was classified into Category 2.

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale: In rabbits that were treated dermally with the substance for 24 hours, conjunctival edema was present in 4 of the 6 animals 8 days later (DFGOT vol. 10 (1998)). From these results, the substance was classified into Category 2A.

germ_cell_mutagenicity.rationale: This substance is reported to be sensitizing in animal tests (DFGOT vol. 10 (1998)). However, since the test methods, animal species used, and number of animals were not clarified, the substance was classified into the "Classification not possible" category due to insufficient data available.

carcinogenicity.rationale: Positive results are reported in Ames tests and in vitro chromosomal aberration tests (DFGOT vol. 10 (1998)). However, since no appropriate in vivo test results are available, classification is not possible.

toxic_to_reproduction.rationale: It is rated as "2" by the EU (EU 2007). In animal experiments, it is reported that female mice that received dermal or oral administration of the substance developed tumors in the skin, forestomach, and lungs (DFGOT vol. 10 (1998)). However, since there are no other test results available, the substance was classified into the "Classification not possible" category due to insufficient data available.

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.rationale: In reproductive and developmental toxicity tests using rats that received the substance via oral administration or inhalation exposure, seminal duct atrophy and increase in cervical ribs in the offspring were found (DFGOT vol. 10 (1998)). However, the relevance of these findings to reproductive and developmental toxicity is not clear. Thus, the substance was classified into the "Classification not possible" category due to insufficient data available available.

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Single exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.rationale: In oral administration or inhalation exposure tests using rats, posture disorder, protrusion of the eyes, dilated pupils, and changes in the lungs and liver were noted at doses around LD50 (DFGOT vol. 10 (1998)). However, since no explanations on doses used and presence/absence of mortality were provided, the substance was classified into the "Classification not possible" category due to insufficient test results available.

aspiration_hazard.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Repeated exposure
aspiration_hazard.classification: Category 1 (central nervous system, testis, liver, respiratory system)
aspiration_hazard.hazard_statement: Cause damage to organs through prolonged or repeated exposure (central nervous system, testis, liver, respiratory system)
aspiration_hazard.rationale: In oral administration or inhalation exposure tests using rats, central nervous effects, testicular atrophy, changes in the liver, and changes in the respiratory system were noted at doses that fall under Category 1 (DFGOT vol. 10 (1998)). Based on these results, the substance was classified into Category 1 (central nervous system, testis, liver, and respiratory system).

acute_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Since its 96-hour LC50 is 26.5 mg/L for fish (Branchydanio rerio) (IUCLID, 2000), the substance was classified into Category 3 for acute toxicity.

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_statement: Harmful to aquatic life with long lasting effects
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Its classification for acute toxicity is Category 3, it is not rapidly degradable (BIOWIN, 2007), and logPow = 4.54 (SRC, 2005). Based on this information, the substance was classified into Category 3 for chronic toxicity.
